intro: Veronica pubescens subsp. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy speedwell, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It features upright, branched stems covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive fuzzy appearance. The plant produces small, blue to violet flowers in whorled clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and also bear a pubescent texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
